```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(quanteda)
library(ggplot2)
library(readtext)
library(dslabs)
library(widyr)
library(ggraph)
library(tidytext)

x <- corpus(readtext("C:/Users/Suhaas Ramani/Desktop/R Research Project - Facebook Ads/Maharashtra_txt.txt"))

x <- tokens(x, remove_numbers = TRUE, remove_punct = TRUE, 
            remove_symbols = TRUE, remove_separators = TRUE, 
            split_hyphens = TRUE, remove_url = TRUE)

x <- tokens_select(x, names(data_int_syllables))
x <- tokens_select(x, c("amp", "s"), selection = "remove")

dfmx <- dfm(x)

dfmx <- dfmx %>% dfm(remove = stopwords('english')) %>% dfm_trim(min_termfreq = 20)

words_dfm <- textstat_frequency(dfmx)
features_words_dfm <- words_dfm$feature


ds_theme_set()
MH_freq_plot <- ggplot(words_dfm, aes(x = feature, y = frequency)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  xlab("words") +
  geom_text(aes(label=paste(frequency)), size = 2.5, nudge_y = 4) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, vjust = -0.00001)) + 
  ggtitle("Frequency Plot for Congress Ads in Maharashtra")
MH_freq_plot

y <- corpus(readtext("C:/Users/Suhaas Ramani/Desktop/R Research Project - Facebook Ads/Maharashtra_txt.txt"))

y_dat <- data.frame(text = sapply(y, as.character), stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

y_bigram <- y_dat %>% 
  unnest_tokens(bigram, text, token = "ngrams", n = 2)


y_bigram_sep <- y_bigram %>% 
  separate(bigram, c("word1", "word2"), sep = " ")

y_bigrams_filtered <- y_bigram_sep %>%
  filter(!word1 %in% stop_words$word) %>%
  filter(!word2 %in% stop_words$word)

y_bigram_counts <- y_bigrams_filtered %>% 
  count(word1, word2, sort = TRUE)


y_test <- y_bigram_counts[1:36, ]

y_test <- y_test[-c(1, 3, 10, 14, 15, 16, 17, 20, 22, 24, 31, 32, 33), ]

library(igraph)

y_test_graph <- y_test %>% 
  graph_from_data_frame()

library(ggraph)

set.seed(2017)

ggraph(y_test_graph, layout = "fr") +
  geom_edge_link() +
  geom_node_point() +
  geom_node_text(aes(label = name), vjust = 1, hjust = 1)

set.seed(2020)

a <- grid::arrow(type = "closed", length = unit(.10, "inches"))

ggraph(y_test_graph, layout = "fr") +
  geom_edge_link(aes(edge_alpha = n), show.legend = FALSE,
                 arrow = a, end_cap = circle(.05, 'inches')) +
  geom_node_point(color = "lightblue", size = 4) +
  geom_node_text(aes(label = name), vjust = 1, hjust = 1) +
  theme_void()

AFINN <- get_sentiments("afinn")

word1_sentiments <- y_test %>%
  inner_join(AFINN, by = c(word1 = "word")) %>% 
  count(word1, value, sort = TRUE)
word1_sentiments
sum(word1_sentiments$value*word1_sentiments$n)

word2_sentiments <- y_test %>% 
  inner_join(AFINN, by = c(word2 = "word")) %>% 
  count(word2, value, sort = TRUE)
word2_sentiments
sum(word2_sentiments$value*word2_sentiments$n)


y_test_cor <- y_test %>% 
  pairwise_cor(word1, word2, sort = TRUE) 
y_test_cor
  
y_test_cor %>%
  filter(item1 %in% c("comprehensive", "jobs", "public", "govt")) %>% 
  group_by(item1) %>% 
  top_n(10) %>% 
  ungroup() %>%
  mutate(item2 = reorder(item2, correlation)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(item2, correlation)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  facet_wrap(~ item1, scales = "free") +
  coord_flip()

# I only chose the top 4 words as per its use. I can add more and make separate plots if needed. 
  
```
